processVariables.name: Last Inv. Item Document Number of the Clearing Document
processVariables.displayName: Last Inv. Item Document Number of the Clearing Document

parameter.name: Last Inv. Item Document Number of the Clearing Document

children.name: Introduction
Analyze and Improve your Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)

blocks.text: This dashboard provides transparency on how you can optimize your Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) considering both items originating from sales billing documents and from FI invoices.  DSO measures the average number of days it takes for a company to collect payment after a sale has been made. Customers paying on time positively impact your cash conversion cycle since you can use timely customer payments to invest in operations, repay debts, or pursue growth opportunities, leading to overall financial health.
The following dashboard helps you to detect root causes for late customer payments and includes recommendations on how to avoid late customer payments in the future.
This dashboard is structured as follows:
General Overview: Understand to which extent late customer payments are an issue for your company and how they impact your DSO
Avoid late customer payments: Learn in which organizational units late customer payments mostly occur and detect root causes for late customer payments
Use dunning to improve DSO: Explore which effect dunning has on late customer payments and how it can be used to avoid late customer payments moving forward
Details: In case you would like to drill down to a single document level, you may use this view to get further details for each invoice document
Timeframe

The invoices included in this analysis are selected based on their document date.  Please be aware that only completed cases are included in this dashboard, i.e. cases that have been cleared (Last Inv. Item Document Number of the Clearing Document field is not null).

children.name: MIN Case Creation Date
children.description: The date on which the first invoice was issued based on the document date

dataSource.query:
SELECT MIN("Inv. Date")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: MAX Case Creation Date
children.description: The date on which the last invoice was issued based on the document date

dataSource.query:
SELECT MAX("Inv. Date")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: 01. General Overview
Number of Cases
children.description: Total number of invoices that have been created within the reference period

children.name: Total Invoice Amount
children.description: Gross invoice amount for all invoices

children.name: General Overview

blocks.text: The following analysis shows to which extent customers pay late, in which organizational units this issue is prevalent and which impact late payments have on your company's financial performance.

Payments are considered late payments if the clearing date is later compared to the net due date of the open item. The financial impact is calculated based on an assumed interest rate, i.e. which interest amount could have been earned if the money had been invested otherwise.

children.name: Amount of On-Time and Late Payment Over Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" ) AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
    SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Amount affected",
	CASE 
	 	WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
	THEN 'Late payment'
    	WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" <= "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
	THEN 'On-time payment'
	END AS "Clearing behaviour"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('month'), NULL

children.name: Customer Clearing Behaviour by Top 10 Company Codes and Invoice Amount
children.description: Showing clearing behaviour for the 10 company codes with the biggest invoice amount

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Invoice amount", 
 		"Inv. Company Code",
		"Clearing behaviour"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Invoice amount", 
         "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Inv. Company Code",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice amount", 
         CASE WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date" THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date > Net due date",
		 CASE 
	 		WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
				THEN 'Late payment'
    		WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" <= "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
				THEN 'On-time payment'
		 END AS "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Inv. Company Code",
         SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Inv. Company Code") as "sum"
         FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
      WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC

children.name: On-Time Payment Rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices (monetary) cleared on-time, i.e. before net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" <= "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	/ SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Customer Clearing Behaviour by Top 10 Customers and Invoice Amount
children.description: Showing clearing behaviour for the 10 customers with the biggest invoice amount

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Invoice amount", 
 		"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
		"Clearing behaviour"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Invoice amount", 
         "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice amount", 
         CASE WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date" THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date > Net due date",
		 CASE 
	 		WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
				THEN 'Late payment'
    		WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" <= "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
				THEN 'On-time payment'
		 END AS "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
         SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Last Inv. Item Customer Number") as "sum"
         FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC

children.name: Prioritizing Company Codes and Customers for On-Time Payment Performance Improvement

blocks.text: Analyzing the breakdown by company code, enables you to understand how organizational units perform in terms of on-time payment performance. It provides information on whether certain company codes struggle with late customer payments and thus prioritize them accordingly when it comes to process improvements.

Additionally, it is helpful to understand whether customers pay late. For example, if some of your biggest customers pay late, the impact on your working capital is particularly negative and you might want to address these customers specifically and/or consider offering discounts to these customers.

children.name: On-time Payment Amount
children.description: Amount of invoices cleared on-time, i.e. before net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		(SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") -
		(
		 SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
				(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
		)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Percentage On-Time and Late Payment Over Time
children.description: Development of on-time payment and late payment rate over time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" ) AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date", 
    "CB Name" AS "KPI Name",
	"KPI" AS "Clearing behaviour"
FROM
(
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" ) AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
    SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
							(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    / SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "KPI",
    'Late payment rate' AS "CB Name"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" ) AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
    SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" <= "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	/ SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "KPI",
    'On-time payment rate' AS "CB Name"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub1
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('month'), NULL

children.name: Late Payment Rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices (based on monetary value) cleared late, i.e. after the net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	/ SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Financial Impact of Late Payments
children.description: Calculating the impact of late payments with an assumed interest rate of 4% which could have earned with the money if it had been paid on time

dataSource.query:
SELECT  (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
        )
        * DURATION_TO_DAYS(AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER (
        WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")))
		* 0.04 / 365)
		AS "Financial impact"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL

children.name: Assess Clearing Behavior Over Time

blocks.text: In order to detect patterns and/or improvements regarding your customers' on-time payment performance, the following analyses provide insights on how your on-time payment performance evolves over time including the rate of on-time and late payments. This enables you to understand whether there are improvements in your customers' payment behavior over time and whether there are certain peaks in late payments.

children.name: Late Payment Amount
children.description: Amount of invoices cleared late, i.e. after the net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		(SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
        (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: 02. Avoid Late Payments
Avoid Late Customer Payments and Reduce Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)

blocks.text: From a working capital perspective, late payments are an issue because they increase Days Sales Outstanding. However, they can only be influenced indirectly in most cases since it is the decision of you customers when to pay you (unless payment method direct debit is used). The following analyses provide insights into potential root causes for late payments. This is a starting point for you to define how to avoid late payments moving forward.
Please note that the calculation of the financial impact of late payments is calculated based on an assumed interest rate.

children.name: Late Payment Rate and Amount over Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('month', "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date") AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
    SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	/ SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate",
    SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
		(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

children.name: Top 10 Company Codes by Late Payment Amount and Late Payment Rate

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Late payment rate", 
 		"Inv. Company Code" AS "Company Code"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Late payment rate", 
         "Inv. Company Code",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
 				AS "Affected amount", 
        	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	    / SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate", 
         	"Inv. Company Code",
         	SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Inv. Company Code") as "sum"
       FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
NULLS LAST
LIMIT 10

children.name: Top 10 Customers by Late Payment Amount and Late Payment Rate

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Late payment rate", 
 		"Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Late payment rate", 
         "Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
 				AS "Affected amount", 
        	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	    / SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate",
         	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
         	SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
		       (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Last Inv. Item Customer Number") as "sum"
       FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
NULLS LAST
LIMIT 10

children.name: Analyzing Customer Payment Delays

blocks.text: When analyzing late payments, it is crucial to understand how late invoices are paid.

If invoices are paid a couple of days late, the financial impact might not be very big,. However, if invoices are paid significantly late, there is a big financial impact since you might have planned to use the money for other purposes as part of your cashflow planning.

That's why the analysis on the right separates late payments into buckets so that you can assess how big of an issue your late payments are and what impact they have. Depending on that, you can refine your analysis.

children.name: Late Payments by Categorization
children.description: Shows how late payments are performed based on buckets

dataSource.query:
SELECT
   SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount" ) AS "Amount affected",
   CASE
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '0day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '7day' THEN 'a. 0-7 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '7day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '14day' THEN 'b. 8-14 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '14day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '30day' THEN 'c. 15-30 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '30day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '60day' THEN 'd. 31-60 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '60day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '90day' THEN 'e. 61-90 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '90day' THEN 'f. >90 days'
    END AS "Clearing Category",
	"Inv. Document Type Text" AS "FI Document Type"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
ORDER BY
  2 ASC
 NULLS LAST

children.name: Late Payment Rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices paid late, i.e. after net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
            / SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Amount Paid Late
children.description: Amount of invoices paid late, i.e. after net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
		(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG Days too Late
children.description: Calculates the average of how late late payment are performed by taking into account the difference between the clearing date and the net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "AVG days too late"
    FROM THIS_PROCESS
	WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"

children.name: Late Payments by Root Cause Category
children.description: Late payments by root cause category (RCA)

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(
--Immediate payment terms--
SELECT
'Immediate payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" IS NULL
        OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" = 0)
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL

--Dunning--
SELECT
'Dunning not used' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
    WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NULL
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL
------------
--'Other'---
------------
SELECT
"Category" AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Inv. Converted USD Amount",
CASE
--'Immediate payment terms'
WHEN "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" IS NULL
OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" = 0 THEN 'RCA'
--'Dunning'
WHEN "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NULL THEN 'RCA'
ELSE 'Other' END AS "Category"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
) as sub1
WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
) as sub2
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
ORDER BY 2 DESC

children.name: Prioritizing Company Codes and Customers to Avoid Late Payments

blocks.text: Company Codes which show a high amount of cases with late payments might need special attention. You might also want to take a look at customers who are often paying late. Based on that, you can filter the following analyses for root causes for late payments based on the company codes respectively customers which are mostly affected by late payments.

children.name: Detect Patterns and Financial Impact of Late Payments

blocks.text: The following analysis helps you to identify the combination of company codes and customers mostly affected by late payments. It also provides input on the affected amount and whether the payment run was used for clearing. In case the payment run was used for clearing, but the clearing is still late, the following root cause analysis might help to detect the reason for late payments such as blocking, immediate payment terms etc.

children.name: Root Cause Analysis for Late Payments

blocks.text: Assuming that you have an issue with late payments, it's essential to detect root causes for late payments in order to avoid late payments moving forward.
The following categories are provided in order to provide insights into root causes for late payments:

Immediate payment terms: If the open items are due very soon or even immediately after you have created them, chances are high your customers will pay late. Understand how the usage of payment conditions impact your late payment rate.
Dunning not used: Not using dunning to remind and penalize customers in case of late payments increases the probability of late payments.
Others: Cases that were paid after the net due date but do not fall into any of the defined root cause categories.
Be aware that the several potential root causes might apply to the same invoice document.
More detailed insights into each root cause category are provided in the following analyses.

children.name: Immediate Payment Terms

blocks.text: Asking customers to pay immediately often results in late payments since immediate payments would only be possible if the customer receives and pays the invoice on the same day the sales billing document has been created.
In order to understand how to optimize your payment term usage in general, please refer to the dashboard "Optimize Your Payment Term Usage".

children.name: Dunning Not Used

blocks.text: Dunning is a measure to avoid late payments by reminding and penalizing customers in case they pay to late. If dunning is not used, you might miss a chance to avoid late payments. Use the analysis to identify for which customers you are currently not using dunning but could use it to improve your DSO.

children.name: Root Cause Analysis: Immediate Payment Terms by Top 10 Customers

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
		"Inv. Document Type Text" AS "Document Type",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
--'Immediate payment terms'
SELECT
'Immediate payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
"Inv. Document Type Text",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" IS NULL
        OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" = 0) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
) as sub1
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date" 
AND "RCA category" IS NOT NULL
AND "Amount affected" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 3 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Root Cause Analysis: Dunning Not Used by Top 10 Customers

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
		"Inv. Document Type Text" AS "Document Type",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
SELECT
"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
'Dunning not used' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Inv. Document Type Text",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
    WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NULL
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub1
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date" 
AND "RCA category" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 3 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Root cause analysis for late payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
		CASE
    		WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        	ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    	END AS "Process Variant",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
--'Immediate payment terms'
SELECT
'Immediate payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" IS NULL
        OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" = 0) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL
--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
SELECT
'Unfavorable payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
	    WHERE "Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Baseline date" <  DURATION '15days'
        AND ("Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1" = 0
        OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1" IS NULL)
		AND "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" > 0
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Posted as overdue'
SELECT
'Posted as overdue' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "Accounting document entry date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Late invoice approval'
SELECT
'Late invoice approval' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "Release date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
		IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
SELECT
'Payment condition not correctly defined' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL         
--'Late goods receipt'
SELECT
'Late goods receipt' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "Payment block" = 'R' 
        AND "Release date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL         
--'Late invoice verification'
SELECT
'Late invoice verification' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL       
--'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction'
SELECT
'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL
--'Manual interactions'
SELECT
'Manual interactions' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
  		AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) > 2 )
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Low automation of invoice postings'
SELECT
'Low automation of invoice postings' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE ( SELECT COUNT(1) FILTER (
		WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') / 
		COUNT(1) * 100) > 20 ) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL           
--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
SELECT
'Supplier changed after invoice posting' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Invoicing party changed'
)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL  
--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'
SELECT
'Quantity Changes after invoice posting' AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Quantity changed'
)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL
------------
--'Other'---
------------
SELECT 
"Category" AS "RCA category",
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
"Last Inv. Item Due Date",
"Process Flow",
"Inv. Converted USD Amount",
CASE
--'Immediate payment terms'
WHEN "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" IS NULL
OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" = 0 THEN 'RCA'
--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
WHEN "Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Baseline date" <  DURATION '15days'
        AND ("Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1" = 0
		OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1" IS NULL) THEN 'RCA'
--'Posted as overdue'
WHEN "Accounting document entry date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date" THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice approval'
WHEN    "Release date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
		IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL THEN 'RCA'
--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
WHEN "PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL THEN 'RCA'
--'Late goods receipt'
WHEN "Payment block" = 'R' 
        AND "Release date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice verification'
WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction'
WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Manual interactions'
WHEN (SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
  		AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) > 2 
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Low automation of invoice postings'
WHEN ( SELECT COUNT(1) FILTER (
		WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') / 
		COUNT(1) * 100) > 20 THEN 'RCA'
--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Invoicing party changed'
) THEN 'RCA'
--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'
WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Quantity changed'
) THEN 'RCA'
ELSE 'Other' END AS "Category"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date" 
) as sub1
WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
) as sub2
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date" 
ORDER BY 3 DESC

children.name: Impact of Late Payments: Company Code/Customer with more than 10 Cases Affected by Late Payment Rate
children.description: Impact of Late Payments: Company Code/Customer combinations more than 10 cases affected ordered by late payment rate

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
    "Inv. Company Code" AS "Company Code",
	"Inv. Company Code Text",
    "Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
	"# Cases",
    "Invoice amount",
    "Financial impact",
	"Late payment rate",
	"Cases affected",
    "Amount affected",
	"# Invoices cleared with discount applied",
 	"# Invoices cleared without offered discount"

FROM
(
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date") AS "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# Cases",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice amount",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id)  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Cases affected",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount" )  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Amount affected",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	/ SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate",
        "Inv. Company Code",
	"Inv. Company Code Text",
    "Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
	COUNT(1) FILTER (
	WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL
    AND "Inv. Reversal Indicator" IS NULL 
    AND "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency" > 0) AS "# Invoices cleared with discount applied",
	COUNT(1) FILTER (
	WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL
    AND "Inv. Reversal Indicator" IS NULL 
    AND "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency" = 0
	AND "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" > 0) AS "# Invoices cleared without offered discount",
    (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
        )
        * DURATION_TO_DAYS(AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER (
        WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")))
	* 0.04 / 365)
	AS "Financial impact"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub
WHERE "Cases affected" > 10
ORDER BY 6 DESC, 9 DESC

children.name: Detailed Root Cause Analyses for Late Payments

blocks.text: Based on the previous analysis, you might have learnt that your late payment rate, coming with negative consequences on your DSO and thus working capital, originate from root causes such as disadvantageous payment conditions or making business with customers which have a tendency for paying late. In order to drill down further into the different root causes and derive measures to avoid those moving forward, you can use the following analyses which provide more detailed insights into each root cause category.

children.name: Number of Cases Cleared Late but Discount Applied
children.description: Number of invoices cleared after net due date but with discount applied

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
COUNT(1) FILTER (
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
AND "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency" > 0
) AS "# Invoices"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Detect Patterns and Financial Impact of Cases Cleared Late but Discount Applied

blocks.text: The following analysis helps you to identify the combination of company codes and customers mostly affected by late payments, where cash discount has been applied.

children.name: Impact of Cases Cleared Late but Discount Applied

dataSource.query:
SELECT
"Inv. Company Code",
"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
"# Cases",
"Invoice amount",
"Financial impact",
"Cases affected",
"Amount affected",
"Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency taken for cases affected",
"Average cash discount offered",
"AVG days too late"
FROM (
SELECT 
	"Inv. Company Code",
    "Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# Cases",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice amount",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id)  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
			AND "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency" > 0) AS "Cases affected",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount" )  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
			AND "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency" > 0) AS "Amount affected",
	
	SUM("Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency" ) FILTER (
			WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    		AND "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency" > 0 ) AS "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency taken for cases affected",
	AVG ( CASE WHEN "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2" > 0 THEN 
		"Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2" ELSE "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1"
    	END) AS "Average cash discount offered",
    AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER (
		WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
		AS "AVG days too late",
	(SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
        )
        * DURATION_TO_DAYS(AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER (
        WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")))
	* 0.04 / 365)
	AS "Financial impact"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB 
WHERE "Cases affected" > 0
ORDER BY 5 DESC

children.name: 03. Use Dunning to Improve DSO
Use Dunning to improve Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)

blocks.text: Dunning refers to the process of systematically communicating with customers who have outstanding payments to encourage them to settle their debts. Dunning is crucial for improving DSO. By sending reminders at appropriate intervals, you can increase the likelihood of receiving payments promptly, reducing the time it takes to collect outstanding amounts. By monitoring and following up on overdue accounts, you can identify customers who may be facing financial difficulties and take appropriate measures, such as adjusting credit terms or implementing stricter credit controls.

children.name: Dunning Rate for Late Payments and Amount Over Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('month', "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date") AS "Clearing Date",
    COUNT(1) FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL
			AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
            / COUNT(1) FILTER
	(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") * 100 AS "Dunning rate",
    SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
		(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL
		AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Amount affected"
        FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

children.name: Analyzing Dunning Impact on Customer Clearing Behaviour

blocks.text: In order to assess the impact of dunning, it is essential to understand how fast customers pay after they have been last dunned. The analysis to the right shows how long it takes customers to pay after they have been last dunned.

children.name: Impact of Dunning on Clearing Behavior by Categorization
children.description: Shows how late late payments are performed after dunning based on buckets

dataSource.query:
SELECT
   SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount" ) AS "Amount affected",
   CASE
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) > DURATION '0day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
      ) <= DURATION '3day' THEN 'a. 1-3 days'
	WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) > DURATION '3day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) <= DURATION '7day' THEN 'b. 4-7 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) > DURATION '7day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) <= DURATION '14day' THEN 'c. 8-14 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) > DURATION '14day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) <= DURATION '30day' THEN 'd. 15-30 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) > DURATION '30day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) <= DURATION '60day' THEN 'e. 31-60 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) > DURATION '60day'
    AND (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) <= DURATION '90day' THEN 'f. 61-90 days'
    WHEN (
      "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
    ) > DURATION '90day' THEN 'g. >90 days'
    END AS "Days until clearing",
	"Inv. Document Type Text" AS "Document Type"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
"Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Dunned On"
ORDER BY
  2 ASC
 NULLS LAST

children.name: Dunning Rate for Late Payments
children.description: Percentage of invoices that were dunned over all late payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		COUNT(1) FILTER
        (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL
		AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		)
        / COUNT(1) FILTER
		(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") * 100 AS "Dunning rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Amount of Dunned Late Payments
children.description: Amount of dunned late payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
		(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL
		AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG Days: Clearing Date and Last Dunning Date for Late Payments
children.description: Average days between clearing date and last dunning date for late payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT
AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" -  "Last Inv. Item Dunned On") FILTER (
	WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
 	AS "AVG days between clearing and last dunning"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Detect Patterns and Impact of Dunning

blocks.text: The following analysis helps you to identify the combination of company codes and customers mostly affected by late payments. It also provides input on the affected amount, dunning blocks and whether they were previously dunned.

children.name: Impact of Dunning on Late Payment by Customer by Number of Dunned Cases

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Inv. Company Code" AS "Company Code",
    "Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
	"# Cases",
	"Invoice amount",
	"Late payment rate",
	"# Cases with late payments",
    "Amount paid late",
	"Last Inv. Item Dunning Block",
	"Cases with dunning",
	"MAX dunning level",
    "AVG days too late for invoices without dunning",
	"AVG days too late for invoices dunned"

FROM
(
SELECT 
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# Cases",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice amount",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id)  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "# Cases with late payments",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount" )  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "Amount paid late",
	SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date")
    	/ SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") * 100 AS "Late payment rate",
	"Inv. Company Code",
    "Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id)  FILTER
			(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL) AS "Cases with dunning",
    MAX(TO_NUMBER("Last Inv. Item Dunning Level")) AS "MAX dunning level",
    AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NULL AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date" > DURATION '14days'
		AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
		)
    AS "AVG days too late for invoices without dunning",
	AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date" > DURATION '14days'
    	AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "AVG days too late for invoices dunned",
	"Last Inv. Item Dunning Block" 
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub
ORDER BY 9 DESC

children.name: AVG Days Too Late without Dunning (Overdue by > 14 days)
children.description: Calculates the average of how late late payment are performed by taking into account the difference between the clearing date and the net due date for all cases that were not dunned and which are overdue by more than 14 days

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER
    (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NULL
    AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
    AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date" > DURATION '14days'
	)
	 AS "AVG days too late for invoices without dunning"
    FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Average Days Too Late with Dunning (Overdue by > 14 days)
children.description: Calculates the average of how late late payment are performed by taking into account the difference between the clearing date and the net due date for all cases that were dunned and which are overdue by more than 14 days

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER
    (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL 
    AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
	AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date" > DURATION '14days'
	) AS "AVG days too late for invoices dunned"
    FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Average Days Too Late with Dunning by Dunnig Level

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Last Inv. Item Dunning Level" As "Dunning Level",
	AVG("Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date") FILTER
    (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL 
	AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date") AS "AVG days too late"
    FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunning Level" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 ASC

children.name: Analyze Items and Customers with Dunning Blocks

blocks.text: Setting dunning blocks on customer or open item level prevents customers from being dunned in case of late payments. The following analysis provides an overview of those late payments for which a dunning block has been set. Verify whether this block is justified and whether it would be an option to remove the block moving forward to allow dunning or whether the dunning block is set due to issues coming up during invoice verification on customer side. If the latter happens very often, this might be a reason to follow up on potential fulfillment and/or quality issues for the affected goods/services.

children.name: Identify Most Frequently Dunned Customers

blocks.text: The following analysis shows those customers which are dunned most frequently and the customers with the highest dunning level. Based on this, you can derive measures such as a stricter credit limit for these customers.

children.name: Overview of Items with Dunning Block for Late Payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
    "case_id" as "Case ID",
    "Inv. Company Code",
	"SD organization",
	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
	"Last Inv. Item Billing Document",
    "Inv. Accounting Document Number",
    "Inv. Fiscal year",
	"Last Inv. Item Dunned On" ,
    "Last Inv. Item Dunning Block" ,
    "Last Inv. Item Dunning Area",
    "Last Inv. Item Dunning Level" ,
    "Last Inv. Item Dunning Block" 

FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunning Block" IS NOT NULL 
    AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"

children.name: Top 10 Customers with Most Invoices Dunned

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
	COUNT(1) FILTER
        (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunned On" IS NOT NULL) AS "# Cases affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 2 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Top 10 Customers with Highest Dunning Level

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
	MAX(TO_NUMBER("Last Inv. Item Dunning Level")) AS "Highest dunning level"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
	WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunning Level" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 2 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Top 10 Customers by Dunning Block for Late Payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
    "Last Inv. Item Dunning Block",
	COUNT(1) AS "# Cases affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Last Inv. Item Dunning Block" IS NOT NULL 
    AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"

children.name: 04. Details
Customer Payment Performance Details by Case

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
    "case_id" AS "Case ID",
    "Inv. Company Code",
	"SD organization",
	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
	"Last Inv. Item Billing Document",
    "Inv. Accounting Document Number",
    "Inv. Fiscal Year",
	"Inv. Document Type Text" AS "Document Type",
	"Inv. Converted USD Amount",
	CASE 
	 	WHEN "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
	THEN 'Late payment'
	ELSE 'On-time payment'
    END AS "Clearing behaviour",
    ---RCA---
	
    "Inv. Accounting Document Date",
	"Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key",
	 CASE 
    			WHEN "Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date" > DURATION '14days'
    			THEN 'Unfavorable payment terms'
    			ELSE 'Favorable payment terms'
				END AS "Payment terms category",
	"Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 2",
    "Last Inv. Item Net Payment Terms Period",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
